title: Legendary sports commentator Bruce McAvaney lists Adelaide beachside home
text:
Prominent sports commentator Bruce McAvaney is saying goodbye to his million dollar Glenelg South home, which he has shared with TV producer wife Anne Johnson for the past 20 years.

The couple has temporarily relocated to Sydney, to allow McAvaney to work on the Tokyo 2020 Olympics coverage next year, subsequently selling their beachfront property at 39 South Esplanade.

The property has been listed with Harris Real Estate with a price guide of $2.45 million to $2.695 million – $1.709 million above the suburb’s median house price of $986,000, according to CoreLogic.

Mr McAvaney said the home had been a great entertainer and had hosted a number of well-known sporting identities, however he remained tight-lipped about any favourite guests.

“Answering that would be asking for trouble,” he said.

“Seriously, I’m not big on having people to stay, but for many years we shared our summers with other families who have kids of similar ages.

“We entertained a lot more when we were a bit younger. Every year we had barbecues for groups of visiting commentators and athletes.”

Although the couple will be relocating to Sydney, Mr McAvaney said they will return to Glenelg – having purchased an apartment in the new Ei8ht development in Glenelg South.

“We’ve bought an apartment just up the road that we’ll be able to lock up and leave,” he said.

“We will miss the community for the few months that we’re relocating to Sydney. But what we will miss the most is hearing the ocean, even when it’s stormy, it’s spectacular. We can wake up in the morning and clearly see dolphins swimming while we’re still lying in bed.”

Selling agent Karen Dorman said the tightly-held location would undoubtedly prove popular with buyers.

“I think it could attract families, a professional couple or someone that wants to scale down in that location,” she said.

“There’s also a potential interstate market, some people could look at it as a weekender.”

The home features an open-plan living, dining and kitchen area, a private lounge and living room, a family bathroom, a laundry and an outdoor entertainment area on the ground floor.

Head upstairs and you will find the master suite complete with ocean views, a walk-in robe and ensuite. You will also find three bedrooms, a family bathroom and a family area, plus access to the sweeping balcony.

Expressions of interest will close on Thursday, October 31 at noon.
